head.note: This manuscript contains: Serapion. The history of Macarius the Great, composed by Serapion. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 1 item.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

msItem.title: The history of Macarius the Great, composed by Serapion
msItem.rubric: ܬܘܒ ܬܫܥܝܬܐ ܕܐܒܐ ܘܪܒܐ ܡܩܪܝ ܩܕܝܫܐ ܐܒܐ ܕܟܠܗܘܢ ܕܝܪ̈ܝܐ ܕܗܘ̣ܘ ܒܡܕܒܪܐ ܕܐܣܩܝܛܝܐ ܫ̇ܗܝܬ. ܐܟܬܒܗ̇ ܕܝܢ ܐܒܐ ܣܪܦܝܘܢ ܪܝܫ ܬܠܡܝ̈ܕܘܗܝ ܕܐܒܐ ܐܢܛܘܢܝܘܣ ܪܒܐ ܘܓܡܝ̣ܪܐ ܘܐܒܐ ܕܟܠܗܘܢ ܕܝܪ̈ܝܐ

physDesc.p: Paper, about 9 1/2 in. by 6 1/4, consisting of 23 leaves, several of which are much stained and torn, especially foll. 1, 14—18, 22 and 23. The quires, three in number, are signed with letters (ܐ, ܒ, ܓ). Leaves are wanting after foll. 1 and 13. There are from 26 to 35 lines in each page.

item.p: Paper, about 9 1/2 in. by 6 1/4, consisting of 23 leaves, several of which are much stained and torn, especially foll. 1, 14—18, 22 and 23. The quires, three in number, are signed with letters (ܐ, ܒ, ܓ). Leaves are wanting after foll. 1 and 13. There are from 26 to 35 lines in each page.

handDesc.handNote: This manuscript is written in a rather inelegant hand of about the xiiith cent.

head.note: This manuscript contains: John the Less. The history of Abbā Bishōi, composed by John the Less. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 1 item.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

msItem.title: The history of Abbā Bishōi, composed by John the Less
msItem.rubric: ܬܫܥܝܬܐ ܕܕܘܒ̈ܪܐ ܕܝܚܝܕܝܐ ܡܣܲܪܩܐ. ܘܓܡ̣ܝܪܐ ܐܒܘܢ ܩܕܝܫܐ ܐܒܐ ܒܝܫܘܝ. ܕܡܢ ܡܕܒܪܐ ܕܐܣܩܝܛܝ. ܟ̣ܬܒܗ ܡܢ ܒܬܪ ܥܘܼܢܕܢܗ ܩܲܫܝܫܐ ܢܲܟܦܐ ܐܒܐ ܝܘܚܢܢ ܙܥ̣ܘܪܐ ܕܗܘ̣ܐ ܠܗ ܐܚܐ ܒܡ̣ܐܬܝܬܗ ܕܠܐܣܩܝܛܝ. ܕܗܘ̣ܘ ܬܪ̈ܝܗܘܢ ܬܠܡ̈ܝܕܐ ܡܫ̈ܥܒܕܐ ܠܩܕܝܫܐ ܐܒܐ ܒܡܘܐܝ. ܡܫܬ݀ܥܐ ܕܝܢ ܫܘܪܝ ܕܘܒܪ̈ܝܗܘܢ ܡܝܬܪ̈ܐ ܘܚܝ̈ܘܗܝ ܡ̈ܠܐܟܝܐ ܘܥܠ ܥܘܢܕܢܗ ܕܗܘ̣ܐ ܒܬܡܢܝܐ ܒܐܒܝܒ ܝܪܚܐ ܕܐܝ̈ܓܘܦܛܝܐ܇ ܕܐܝܬܘܗܝ ܒܬܪܝܢ ܒܬ̣݀ܡܘܙ ܝܪܚܐ ܕܣܘܪ̈ܝܐܐ

physDesc.p: Paper, about 9 5/8 in. by 6 1/8, consisting of 27 leaves (Add. 14,735, foll. 24—50). The quires, three in number, are signed with letters (originally ܐ, ܒ, ܓ, but altered into ܙ, ܚ, ܛ). There are from 24 to 30 lines in each page.

item.p: Paper, about 9 5/8 in. by 6 1/8, consisting of 27 leaves (Add. 14,735, foll. 24—50). The quires, three in number, are signed with letters (originally ܐ, ܒ, ܓ, but altered into ܙ, ܚ, ܛ). There are from 24 to 30 lines in each page.

handDesc.handNote: The manuscript is written in a rather inelegant hand of the xiiith cent.

head.note: This manuscript contains: The history of the martyr Behnām. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 1 item.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

msItem.title: The history of the martyr Behnām
msItem.quote: ܥܠ ܚ̇ܝ̣ܠܐ ܠܐ ܡܬܡܚ̇ܠ̣ܢܐ ܕܚܕ ܟܝܢܐ ܕܬܠܝܬܝܘܬܐ̇ ܩܕܝܫܬܐ ܘܫ̇ܘܝܬ ܒܐܘܣܝܐ ܡܫܪܝܢܢ ܕܢܟܬ݂ܘܒ ܬܫܥܝܬܐ ܡܠܝܬ݀ ܝܘܬܪ̈ܢܐ ܕܢܨܝܚ̣ ܫܘܦܪ̈ܐ ܘܣܗܕܐ ܓܒܝܐ ܡܪܝ ܒܗܢܡ

physDesc.p: Paper, about 9 3/8 in. by 5 3/4, consisting of 21 leaves (Add. 14,735, foll. 51—71). The quires, two in number, are signed with letters (originally ܐ and ܒ, altered into ܝ and ܝܐ). There are from 26 to 31 lines in each page.

item.p: Paper, about 9 3/8 in. by 5 3/4, consisting of 21 leaves (Add. 14,735, foll. 51—71). The quires, two in number, are signed with letters (originally ܐ and ܒ, altered into ܝ and ܝܐ). There are from 26 to 31 lines in each page.

handDesc.handNote: This manuscript is written in a rather inelegant hand of the xiith or xiiith cent.

additions.note: N.B., folio location may not be available for some items below.

item.p: The colophon informs us that it was written in the convent of S. Mary Deipara, called ܒܝܬ ܐܟܣ̈ܢܝܐ or "the house of strangers," near Edessa.

p.quote: ܫܠ̣ܡܬ݀ ܬܫܥܝܬܐ ܗܕܐ ܏ܕܩܕ ܡܪܝ ܒܗܢܡ ܒܛܘܪܐ ܏ܩܕ ܕܐܘܪܗܝ. ܒܕܝܪܐ ܕܝ̇ܠܕܬ݀ ܐܠܗܐ ܕܡܬܩܪܝܐ ܒܝܬ ܐܟܣ̈ܢܝܐ. ܕܟܠ ܕܩ̇ܪܐ ܏ܘܫ

item.p: A marginal note on the same page states that it belonged to the convent of S. Mary Deipara in the Egyptian desert

p.quote: ܐܝ̇ܬܝܗ̇ ܬܫܥ̣ܝܬܐ ܗܕܐ ܠܕܝܪܐ ܩܕܝܫܬܐ ܕܝ̇ܠܕܬ݁ ܐ̇ܠܗܐ ܕܣܘܪ̈ܝܝܐ ܕܒܡܕܒܪܐ܀

origin.origPlace: The convent of S. Mary Deipara, called "the house of strangers," near Edessa

recordHist.source: Manuscript description based on Wright's Catalogue . abbreviated by the Syriaca.org editors.

head.note: This manuscript contains: John Chrysostom. Discourse of John Chrysostom on Mercy; Jacob of Batnae. Metrical discourse of Jacob of Batnae on Love; Ephraim. Metrical discourse of Ephraim on Doctrine. Metrical discourse of Ephraim on the End of the World; John Chrysostom. Discourse of John Chrysostom on Ps. vi. 1; Abbā Bīshōi. The history of Maximus and Domitius; Lives of saints and martyrs .... In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 15 items.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

msItem.title: Discourse of John Chrysostom on Mercy
msItem.rubric: ܬܘܒ ܡܐܡܪܐ ܕܩܕܝܫܐ ܡܪܝ ܐܝܘܐܢܢܝܣ ܕܥܠ ܡܪܚܡܢܘܬܐ
msItem.incipit: ܚ̈ܒܝܒܝ܆ ܝܘܡܢܐ ܙ̇ܕܩ ܕܢܩ̇ܕܫ ܠܫܢܢ ܒܡܠܬܐ ܕܡܪܚܡܢܘܬܐ. ܘܢܬܩܢ ܣ̇ܡܐ ܕܚ̇ܫܚ ܠܚ̈ܛܗܐ ܕܓܘܐ. ܙ̇ܒ̣ܢܐ ܗܘ ܓܝܪ ܗܢܐ ܕܡܪܚܡܢܘܬܐ. ܐܝܟ ܕܫܡ̣ܥܬܘܢ ܡܢ ܦܪܘܩܢ. ܗܫܐ ܕܗܐ ܢܦ̣ܩ ܙܪܘܥܐ ܠܡܙܪܥ ܙܪܥܗ. ܏ܘܫ

msItem.title: Metrical discourse of Jacob of Batnae on Love
msItem.rubric: ܬܘܒ ܡܐܡܪܐ ܕܩܕܝܫܐ ܡܪܝ ܝܥܩܘܒ ܕܥܠ ܚܘܒܐ ܘܥܠ ܗ̇ܝ ܕܠܐ ܢ̇ܛܪ ܐܟܬܐ ܥܠ ܒܥ̈ܠܕܒܒܝܢ
msItem.note: See Assemani, Bibl. Or., t. i., p. 316, no. 84 .

msItem.title: Metrical discourse of Ephraim on Doctrine
msItem.rubric: ܬܘܒ ܡܐܡܪܐ ܕܩܕܝܫܐ ܡܪܝ ܐܦܪܝܡ ܕܥܠ ܝܘܠܦܢܐ
msItem.incipit: ܠܘ ܕܩܛܝܪܐ ܗܘ ܝܘܠܦܢܐ. ܕܨܒܝܢܐ ܗܝ ܡܠ̣ܬ ܚ̈ܝܐ. ܏ܘܫ

msItem.title: Discourse of John Chrysostom on Ps. vi. 1
msItem.rubric: ܬܘܒ ܡܐܡܪܐ ܕܩܕܝܫܐ ܘܠܒܝ̣ܫ ܠܐܠܗܐ ܡܪܝ ܐܝܘܐܢܢܝܣ ܕܥܠ ܡܙܡܘܪܐ ܕܡܪܝܐ ܠܐ ܒܪܘܓܙܟ ܬܐܟܣܢܝ
msItem.incipit: ܥܠܬܐ ܕܬܝܒܘܬܐ ܫܪܝܪܬܐ. ܕܦܐܝܐ ܠܪܝܫܝܬܐ ܕܨܘܡܐ ܏ܩܕ: ܕܝܗ̣ܒܐ ܥܕܬܐ ܕܐܠܗܐ .. ܡܪܬܝܢܘܬܐ ܐܡ̣ܪܬ ܒܪܘܚܐ ܕܩܘܕܫܐ. ܕܒܡܙܡܘܪܐ ܕܐܫܬܐ. ܒܗܢܐ ܓܝܪ ܡܙܡܘܪܐ ܡܬܝܠܦܝܢܢ܇ ܕܒܡ̣ܢܐ ܢܪܥܝܘܗܝ ܠܐܠܗܐ. ܏ܘܫ

msItem.title: The history of Maximus and Domitius
msItem.rubric: ܬܫܥܝܬܐ ܕܩܕ̈ܝܫܐ ܐܚ̈ܐ ܪ̈ܘܡܝܐ ܡܟܣܝܡܘܣ ܘܕܘܡܐܛܝܘܣ ܕܐܬܓܡ̣ܪܘ ܒܡܕܒܪܐ ܕܐܣܩܝܛܐ ܒܝܘ̈ܡܝ ܐܒܐ ܡܩܪܝܣ ܪܒܐ ܘܐܒܐ ܐܝܣܝܘܕܪܐ ܓܒܪܐ ܚܣܝܐ ܘܪܚ̇ܡ ܐܠܗܐ. ܡ̇ܟܬܒܐ ܕܝܢ ܠܛܘܒܢܐ ܐܒܐ ܒܝܫܘܝ ܪܝܫ ܡܫܡ̈ܫܢܐ ܕܥܕܬܐ ܕܩܘܢܣܛܝܢܘܦܘܠܝܣ܆ ܘܗ̣ܘ ܗܘ̣ܐ ܪܝܫ ܡܫ̈ܡܫܢܐ ܒܡܕܒܪܐ ܕܐܣܩܝܛܝ

msItem.title: The history of John of Rome
msItem.rubric: ܬܘܒ ܬܫܥܝܬܐ ܕܥܠ ܩܕܝܫܐ ܝܘܚܢܢ ܒܪ ܡ̈ܠܟܢܐ (ܒܪ ܡ̣̈ܠܟܐ)

msItem.title: Metrical discourse of Ephraim on the End of the World, the Judgment, and the Dead
msItem.rubric: ܬܘܒ ܡܐܡܪܐ ܕܩܕܝܫܐ ܡܪܝ ܐܦܪܝܡ ܕܥܠ ܚܪܬܐ ܘܥܠ ܕܝܢ̣ܐ ܘܥܢ̈ܝ̣ܕܐ
msItem.incipit: ܫܡܥܬ ܕܗ̇ܘܐ ܢܘܚܡܐ̣. ܘܚ̇ܕܝܬ ܕܒܫܝܘܠ ܠܐ ܡܩܘܝܢ. ܏ܘܫ

msItem.title: An extract from another discourse of Ephraim on the Judgment
msItem.incipit: ܡܬܕܟܪ ܐܢܐ ܡܘܡ̈ܝ ܟܠܗܘܢ. ܘܕܝܢ̣ܐ ܕܚܝ̣ܠܐ ܕܢܛܝܪ ܠܝ. ܏ܘܫ

msItem.title: The history of Hilaria, the daughter of Zeno
msItem.rubric: ܬܘܒ ܬܫܥܝܬܐ ܕܥܠ ܩܕܝܫܬܐ ܐܠܐܪܝܐ ܒܪܬܗ ܕܙܝܢܘܢ ܡ̇ܠ̣ܟܐ

msItem.title: The history of the martyr Theodore, who suffered at Euchaita, under the governor Pompilius (sic), in the reign of Julian
msItem.rubric: ܬܘܒ ܬܫܥܝܬܐ ܐܘܟܝܬ ܣܗܕܘܬܐ ܕܩܕܝܫܐ ܬܐܘܕܪܘܕܘܣ܆ (sic) ܟܕ ܐܣܗܕ ܒܐܘܟܝܛܐ ܡܕܝܢܬܐ. ܒܝܘܡ̈ܝ ܦܘܡܦܠܝܘܣ ܐܝܓܡܘܢܐ̣ ܘܕܝܘܠܝܢܘܣ ܪܫܝܥܐ

msItem.title: The history of Mār Hālā of Amid
msItem.rubric: ܬܘܒ ܬܫܥܝܬܐ ܕܡܪܝ ܚ̇ܠܐ ܏ܩܕ ܕܝܪܝܐ ܒܚܝܪܐ ܘܡܢܝܚܢܐ ܕܐܟܣ̈ܢܝܐ ܕܐ܏ܝܬܘ ܒܚܕ ܡܢ ܥܘܡܪ̈ܐ ܕܐܡܕ
msItem.note: See Add. 14,647,no. 33 ; and Land, Anecd. Syr., t. ii., p. 30 of the introduction, and p. 332.

msItem.title: The history of the forty martyrs of Sebaste
msItem.rubric: ܬܘܒ ܟܬܒܝܢܢ ܬܫܥܝܬܐ ܕܐܪ̈ܒܥܝܢ ܣܗ̈ܕܐ ܩܕ̈ܝܫܐ ܕܐܬܟܠܠ ܒܝܡܬܐ ܕܣܒܣܛܝ
msItem.quote: ܡܶܐܠܷܐܛܺܝܘܳܢ. ܗܢܘ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܐܬܬܣܝ̣ܡ ܡܢ ܐܡܗ ܥܠ ܥܓܠܬܐ. ܐܺܝܳܘܐܰܢܢܻܝܣ. ܒ̣ܺܝܒ̣ܺܝܐܰܢܘܳܣ. ܟܽܘܪܕܺܝܘܳܢ. ܓܳܐܺܝܘܳܣ. ܣܰܐܩܶܐܪܕ݂ܘܳܢ. ܕ݂ܳܘܡܢܳܘܣ. ܓ݂ܳܘܪܓ݂ܳܢܶܝܘܳܣ. ܦܪܺܝܣܩܳܘܣ. ܬ݂ܶܐܘܳܕܽܘܠܘܳܣ. ܬ݂ܶܐܘܳܦܺܝܠܘܳܣ. ܐܰܢܐܰܛܺܠܻܝܘܳܣ. ܡܶܐܠܺܝܛܳܘܢ. ܠܽܘܣܝܡܰܐܟ݂ܳܘܣ ܩܰܠܐܰܘܰܕܺܝܘܳܢ. ܗܠܝܢ ܗܘܘ ܪ̈ܝܫܢܐ ܗ̇ܢܘܢ ܕܝ̇ܗܒܝܢ ܗܘܘ ܦܘܢܝ ܦܬܓܡܐ ܩܕܡ ܕܝ̇ܢ̣ܐ ܩܰܐܢܕܺܝܕܘܳܣ. ܩܽܘܪܺܝܘܳܢ. ܐܺܝܠܺܝܐܰܣ. ܐܺܝܣܽܘܟܺܝܘܳܣ. ܕܳܘܡܶܐܛܺܝܐܰܢܘܳܣ. ܐܽܘܰܐܠܺܝܣ. ܐܶܘܛܽܘܟܺܝܘܳܣ. ܐܶܘܢܘܳܩܺܝܘܳܣ. ܐܺܝܠܺܝܺܐܺܢܘܳܣ. ܐܰܠܐܶܟܣܐܰܢܕܪܘܳܣ. ܩܽܘܪܝܺܠܠܘܳܣ. ܦ݁ܰܠܐܒܺܝܘܳܣ. ܣܡܰܐܪܐܰܓ݁ܕ݂ܘܳܣ. ܟ݁ܣܰܐܢܬ݂ܺܝܘܳܣ. ܣܺܝܣܺܝܢܺܝܘܳܣ. ܠܶܐܘܳܢܺܛܝܘܳܣ. ܣܶܐܘܺܝܪܺܝܰܐܢܘܳܣ. ܦܺܝܠܳܘܩܛܺܝܡܳܘܢ. ܐܰܓ݁ܰܓܻ݁ܝܳܘܣ. ܐܺܝܪܐܰܩܠܺܝܘܳܣ. ܐܰܩܕܺܝܩܝܺܘܳܣ. ܐܰܐܶܛܺܝܘܳܣ. ܐܰܬܰܐܢܰܐܣܺܝܘܳܣ. ܐܰܩܰܐܩܺܝܘܳܣ. ܢܺܝܩܳܠܰܐܘܳܣ. ܗܢܘ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܡܲܠܝ ܠܣܕܪܐ ܚܠܦ ܗ̇ܘ ܘܢܦ̣ܩ ܘܥ̣ܠ ܠܒܐܠܐܢܐ ܘܡܝ̣ܬ ܒܗ̇
msItem.note: Their names are given in the above quote from fol. 165 a.

msItem.title: The martyrdom of George
msItem.rubric: ܬܘܒ ܟܬܒܝܢܢ ܬܫܥܝܬܐ ܕܥܠ ܣܗܕܐ ܢܨܝܚܐ ܡܪܝ ܓܐܘܪܓܝܣ

msItem.title: The history of a monk, who quitted his convent, and betook himself to another
msItem.rubric: ܬܘܒ ܟܬܒܝܢܢ ܬܫܥܝܬܐ ܡܛܠ ܐܚܐ ܚܕ ܕܢܦ̣ܩ ܡܢ ܥܘܡܪܗ ܟܕ ܠܐ ܫ̣ܪܐ ܠܗ ܩܢܘܢܐ ܕܝܠܗ ܘܐܙ̣ܠ ܘܩ̇ܒ̣ܠ ܢܦܫܗ ܒܐܚܪܢܐ
msItem.note: See Add. 14,647,no. 18 , and Land, Anecd. Syr., t. ii., p. 30 of the introduction.

physDesc.p: Paper, about 9 5/8 in. by 6 1/8, consisting of 102 leaves (Add. 14,735, foll. 72—173), some of which are much torn, especially foll. 91—93, 95, 96, 112, and 113. The quires, ten in number, are signed with letters, but the signatures have been altered at various times. There are from 22 to 34 lines in each page. From fol. 156 onwards each page is divided into two columns.

item.p: Paper, about 9 5/8 in. by 6 1/8, consisting of 102 leaves (Add. 14,735, foll. 72—173), some of which are much torn, especially foll. 91—93, 95, 96, 112, and 113. The quires, ten in number, are signed with letters, but the signatures have been altered at various times. There are from 22 to 34 lines in each page. From fol. 156 onwards each page is divided into two columns.

handDesc.handNote: This manuscript is written in a good, current hand of about the xiith cent.

item.p:
On fol. 173 a there is a note, stating that the manuscript belonged to the convent of S. Mary Deipara in the desert of Scete, near the village of ܬܐܪܪܢܐ
.

p.quote: ܐܝܬܘܗܝ ܟܬܒܐ ܗܢܐ ܕܬܫ̈ܥܝܬܐ ܘܕܡ̈ܐܡܪܐ ܕܕܝܪܐ ܩܕܝܫܬܐ ܕܒܝܬ ܝ̇ܠܕܬ ܐܠܗܐ ܡܪܝܡ ܕܒܡܕܒܪܐ ܕܐܣܩܝܛܝ ܕܥܠ ܓܢܒ ܛܪܪܢܐ ܩܪܝܬܐ ܡܒܪܟܬܐ. ܒܒܥܘ ܨܠܘ ܥܠ ܕܘܝܘܬܝ. ܏ܘܫ

recordHist.source: Manuscript description based on Wright's Catalogue . abbreviated by the Syriaca.org editors.

bibl.author: William Wright
bibl.title: Catalogue of Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

interpretation.p: Description is based on Wright's Catalogue without consultation of physical manuscripts. Foliation is approximate. Wright often does not indicate ending folia so those have been assumed based on beginning folia.
Scribal notes which could not be more clearly classified based on Wright's descriptions have been identified as <addition>s whether they occur in the margins or the body of the manuscript.
In general, we have classified as an <msItem> as much of the manuscript contents as possible, including tables of contents and indices.

category.catDesc: Catenae Patrum and Demonstrations against Heresies
Councils of the Church and Ecclesiastical Canons

langUsage.language: Arabic Garshuni in East Syriac script
